name: Association European Studies for Innovative Development of Georgia
goal:
Association European Studies for Innovative Development of Georgia (ESIDG) is uniting professors and researchers from a number of universities studying the research, development and innovation (R&D&I) policy and systems and take part in corresponding public debate. ESIDG declares the following activities and goals:
• Study R&I policies worldwide for exploitation of findings in Georgia
• Monitoring of the R&D&I sphere in Georgia and elaboration of recommendations (including on the perfection of EU EaP Programme)
• Enhancing awareness of R&D&I processes in Georgia
• Elaboration of communication formats for academics, students, government, NGOs, etc.
• Sharing of experience with Georgian and EU researchers and organizations
• Involving more researchers from other disciplines to European and R&D&I studies
• Support to integration of Georgia into European area in the R&D&I sphere
The ESIDG members have contributed significantly to explanation of the R&D&I system role to the general public.
ESIDG takes part in EU EaP CSF activities representing CSF the EaP platforms and panels, as well as EaP conferences and workshops within its competence.
ESIDG takes part in EU programmes Horizon2020 and Erazmus+. It elaborates recommendations for the Georgian Government and Parliament, and its members represent the Association in a number of Governmental and Parliamentary councils.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Business and Industry, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Energy, Environment, European Neighbourhood Policy, Regional Policy, Research and innovation
euInitiatives: Eastern Partnership Programme, Horizon-2020 Programme, Jean Monnet Programme, Black Sea Cooperation Programme
